snippet: In the face of Taliban vows to break them, Afghanistan’s security forces proved their resilience after taking charge, American officials said.
abstract: Officials say that Afghan security forces have managed to deter many of Taliban's efforts during 2013, responding well to attacks and reducing assassinations; at same time, Afghan forces have experienced heavy casualties and lack of significant progress; assessment is important factor in determining America's long-term role in country.

byline.original: By ROD NORDLAND, THOM SHANKER and MATTHEW ROSENBERG
byline.contributor: Rod Nordland and Matthew Rosenberg reported from Kabul, and Thom Shanker from Washington. Azam Ahmed contributed reporting from Kabul and Sangin, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: In the face of Taliban vows to break them, Afghanistan’s security forces proved their resilience after taking charge, American officials said.

headline.main: Afghans Fend Off Taliban Threat in Pivotal Year
headline.print_headline: Afghans Fend Off Taliban Threat in Pivotal Year in Charge
